00042 
00043 ControllerManager::ControllerManager(hardware_interface::RobotHW *robot_hw, const ros::NodeHandle& nh) :
00044   robot_hw_(robot_hw),
00045   controller_node_(nh),
00046   cm_node_(nh, "controller_manager"),
00047   start_request_(0),
00048   stop_request_(0),
00049   please_switch_(false),
00050   current_controllers_list_(0),
00051   used_by_realtime_(-1)
00052 {
00053   // create controller loader
00054   controller_loaders_.push_back( LoaderPtr(new ControllerLoader<controller_interface::ControllerBase>("controller_interface",
00055                                                                                                       "controller_interface::ControllerBase") ) );
00056 
00057   // Advertise services (this should be the last thing we do in init)
00058   srv_list_controllers_ = cm_node_.advertiseService("list_controllers", &ControllerManager::listControllersSrv, this);
00059   srv_list_controller_types_ = cm_node_.advertiseService("list_controller_types", &ControllerManager::listControllerTypesSrv, this);
00060   srv_load_controller_ = cm_node_.advertiseService("load_controller", &ControllerManager::loadControllerSrv, this);
00061   srv_unload_controller_ = cm_node_.advertiseService("unload_controller", &ControllerManager::unloadControllerSrv, this);
00062   srv_switch_controller_ = cm_node_.advertiseService("switch_controller", &ControllerManager::switchControllerSrv, this);
00063   srv_reload_libraries_ = cm_node_.advertiseService("reload_controller_libraries", &ControllerManager::reloadControllerLibrariesSrv, this);
00064 }

00067 ControllerManager::~ControllerManager()
00068 {}

00073 // Must be realtime safe.
00074 void ControllerManager::update(const ros::Time& time, const ros::Duration& period, bool reset_controllers)
00075 {
00076   used_by_realtime_ = current_controllers_list_;
00077   std::vector<ControllerSpec> &controllers = controllers_lists_[used_by_realtime_];
00078 
00079   // Restart all running controllers if motors are re-enabled
00080   if (reset_controllers){
00081     for (size_t i=0; i<controllers.size(); i++){
00082       if (controllers[i].c->isRunning()){
00083         controllers[i].c->stopRequest(time);
00084         controllers[i].c->startRequest(time);
00085       }
00086     }
00087   }
00088 
00089 
00090   // Update all controllers
00091   for (size_t i=0; i<controllers.size(); i++)
00092     controllers[i].c->updateRequest(time, period);
00093 
00094   // there are controllers to start/stop
00095   if (please_switch_)
00096   {
00097     // stop controllers
00098     for (unsigned int i=0; i<stop_request_.size(); i++)
00099       if (!stop_request_[i]->stopRequest(time))
00100         ROS_FATAL("Failed to stop controller in realtime loop. This should never happen.");
00101 
00102     // start controllers
00103     for (unsigned int i=0; i<start_request_.size(); i++)
00104       if (!start_request_[i]->startRequest(time))
00105         ROS_FATAL("Failed to start controller in realtime loop. This should never happen.");
00106 
00107     please_switch_ = false;
00108   }
00109 }
00110 
00111 controller_interface::ControllerBase* ControllerManager::getControllerByNameImpl(const std::string& name)
00112 {
00113   std::vector<ControllerSpec> &controllers = controllers_lists_[current_controllers_list_];
00114   for (size_t i = 0; i < controllers.size(); ++i)
00115   {
00116     if (controllers[i].info.name == name)
00117       return controllers[i].c.get();
00118   }
00119   return NULL;
00120 }
00121 
00122 void ControllerManager::getControllerNames(std::vector<std::string> &names)
00123 {
00124   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(controllers_lock_);
00125   std::vector<ControllerSpec> &controllers = controllers_lists_[current_controllers_list_];
00126   for (size_t i = 0; i < controllers.size(); ++i)
00127   {
00128     names.push_back(controllers[i].info.name);
00129   }
00130 }

00132 
00133 bool ControllerManager::loadController(const std::string& name)
00134 {
00135   ROS_DEBUG("Will load controller '%s'", name.c_str());
00136 
00137   // lock controllers
00138   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(controllers_lock_);
00139 
00140   // get reference to controller list
00141   int free_controllers_list = (current_controllers_list_ + 1) % 2;
00142   while (ros::ok() && free_controllers_list == used_by_realtime_){
00143     if (!ros::ok())
00144       return false;
00145     usleep(200);
00146   }
00147   std::vector<ControllerSpec>
00148     &from = controllers_lists_[current_controllers_list_],
00149     &to = controllers_lists_[free_controllers_list];
00150   to.clear();
00151 
00152   // Copy all controllers from the 'from' list to the 'to' list
00153   for (size_t i = 0; i < from.size(); ++i)
00154     to.push_back(from[i]);
00155 
00156   // Checks that we're not duplicating controllers
00157   for (size_t j = 0; j < to.size(); ++j)
00158   {
00159     if (to[j].info.name == name)
00160     {
00161       to.clear();
00162       ROS_ERROR("A controller named '%s' was already loaded inside the controller manager", name.c_str());
00163       return false;
00164     }
00165   }
00166 
00167   ros::NodeHandle c_node;
00168   // Constructs the controller
00169   try{
00170     c_node = ros::NodeHandle(controller_node_, name);
00171   }
00172   catch(std::exception &e) {
00173     ROS_ERROR("Exception thrown while constructing nodehandle for controller with name '%s':\n%s", name.c_str(), e.what());
00174     return false;
00175   }
00176   catch(...){
00177     ROS_ERROR("Exception thrown while constructing nodehandle for controller with name '%s'", name.c_str());
00178     return false;
00179   }
00180   boost::shared_ptr<controller_interface::ControllerBase> c;
00181   std::string type;
00182   if (c_node.getParam("type", type))
00183   {
00184     ROS_DEBUG("Constructing controller '%s' of type '%s'", name.c_str(), type.c_str());
00185     try
00186     {
00187       // Trying loading the controller using all of our controller loaders. Exit once we've found the first valid loaded controller
00188       std::list<LoaderPtr>::iterator it = controller_loaders_.begin();
00189       while (!c && it != controller_loaders_.end())
00190       {
00191         std::vector<std::string> cur_types = (*it)->getDeclaredClasses();
00192         for(size_t i=0; i < cur_types.size(); i++){
00193           if (type == cur_types[i]){
00194             c = (*it)->createInstance(type);
00195           }
00196         }
00197         ++it;
00198       }
00199     }
00200     catch (const std::runtime_error &ex)
00201     {
00202       ROS_ERROR("Could not load class %s: %s", type.c_str(), ex.what());
00203     }
00204   }
00205   else
00206   {
00207     ROS_ERROR("Could not load controller '%s' because the type was not specified. Did you load the controller configuration on the parameter server?", name.c_str());
00208     to.clear();
00209     return false;
00210   }
00211 
00212   // checks if controller was constructed
00213   if (!c)
00214   {
00215     ROS_ERROR("Could not load controller '%s' because controller type '%s' does not exist.",  name.c_str(), type.c_str());
00216     ROS_ERROR("Use 'rosservice call controller_manager/list_controller_types' to get the available types");
00217     to.clear();
00218     return false;
00219   }
00220 
00221   // Initializes the controller
00222   ROS_DEBUG("Initializing controller '%s'", name.c_str());
00223   bool initialized;
00224   std::set<std::string> claimed_resources; // Gets populated during initRequest call
00225   try{
00226     initialized = c->initRequest(robot_hw_, c_node, claimed_resources);
00227   }
00228   catch(std::exception &e){
00229     ROS_ERROR("Exception thrown while initializing controller %s.\n%s", name.c_str(), e.what());
00230     initialized = false;
00231   }
00232   catch(...){
00233     ROS_ERROR("Exception thrown while initializing controller %s", name.c_str());
00234     initialized = false;
00235   }
00236   if (!initialized)
00237   {
00238     to.clear();
00239     ROS_ERROR("Initializing controller '%s' failed", name.c_str());
00240     return false;
00241   }
00242   ROS_DEBUG("Initialized controller '%s' succesful", name.c_str());
00243 
00244   // Adds the controller to the new list
00245   to.resize(to.size() + 1);
00246   to[to.size()-1].info.type = type;
00247   to[to.size()-1].info.hardware_interface = c->getHardwareInterfaceType();
00248   to[to.size()-1].info.name = name;
00249   to[to.size()-1].info.resources = claimed_resources;
00250   to[to.size()-1].c = c;
00251 
00252   // Destroys the old controllers list when the realtime thread is finished with it.
00253   int former_current_controllers_list_ = current_controllers_list_;
00254   current_controllers_list_ = free_controllers_list;
00255   while (ros::ok() && used_by_realtime_ == former_current_controllers_list_){
00256     if (!ros::ok())
00257       return false;
00258     usleep(200);
00259   }
00260   from.clear();
00261 
00262   ROS_DEBUG("Successfully load controller '%s'", name.c_str());
00263   return true;
00264 }
00265

00267 
00268 
00269 bool ControllerManager::unloadController(const std::string &name)
00270 {
00271   ROS_DEBUG("Will unload controller '%s'", name.c_str());
00272 
00273   // lock the controllers
00274   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(controllers_lock_);
00275 
00276   // get reference to controller list
00277   int free_controllers_list = (current_controllers_list_ + 1) % 2;
00278   while (ros::ok() && free_controllers_list == used_by_realtime_){
00279     if (!ros::ok())
00280       return false;
00281     usleep(200);
00282   }
00283   std::vector<ControllerSpec>
00284     &from = controllers_lists_[current_controllers_list_],
00285     &to = controllers_lists_[free_controllers_list];
00286   to.clear();
00287 
00288   // Transfers the running controllers over, skipping the one to be removed and the running ones.
00289   bool removed = false;
00290   for (size_t i = 0; i < from.size(); ++i)
00291   {
00292     if (from[i].info.name == name){
00293       if (from[i].c->isRunning()){
00294         to.clear();
00295         ROS_ERROR("Could not unload controller with name %s because it is still running",
00296                   name.c_str());
00297         return false;
00298       }
00299       removed = true;
00300     }
00301     else
00302       to.push_back(from[i]);
00303   }
00304 
00305   // Fails if we could not remove the controllers
00306   if (!removed)
00307   {
00308     to.clear();
00309     ROS_ERROR("Could not unload controller with name %s because no controller with this name exists",
00310               name.c_str());
00311     return false;
00312   }
00313 
00314   // Destroys the old controllers list when the realtime thread is finished with it.
00315   ROS_DEBUG("Realtime switches over to new controller list");
00316   int former_current_controllers_list_ = current_controllers_list_;
00317   current_controllers_list_ = free_controllers_list;
00318   while (ros::ok() && used_by_realtime_ == former_current_controllers_list_){
00319     if (!ros::ok())
00320       return false;
00321     usleep(200);
00322   }
00323   ROS_DEBUG("Destruct controller");
00324   from.clear();
00325   ROS_DEBUG("Destruct controller finished");
00326 
00327   ROS_DEBUG("Successfully unloaded controller '%s'", name.c_str());
00328   return true;
00329 }
00330 
00331 
00332 
00333 bool ControllerManager::switchController(const std::vector<std::string>& start_controllers,
00334                                          const std::vector<std::string>& stop_controllers,
00335                                          int strictness)
00336 {
00337   if (!stop_request_.empty() || !start_request_.empty())
00338     ROS_FATAL("The switch controller stop and start list are not empty that the beginning of the swithcontroller call. This should not happen.");
00339 
00340   if (strictness == 0){
00341     ROS_WARN("Controller Manager: To switch controllers you need to specify a strictness level of controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::STRICT (%d) or ::BEST_EFFORT (%d). Defaulting to ::BEST_EFFORT.",
00342              controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Request::STRICT,
00343              controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Request::BEST_EFFORT);
00344     strictness = controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Request::BEST_EFFORT;
00345   }
00346 
00347   ROS_DEBUG("switching controllers:");
00348   for (unsigned int i=0; i<start_controllers.size(); i++)
00349     ROS_DEBUG(" - starting controller %s", start_controllers[i].c_str());
00350   for (unsigned int i=0; i<stop_controllers.size(); i++)
00351     ROS_DEBUG(" - stopping controller %s", stop_controllers[i].c_str());
00352 
00353   // lock controllers
00354   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(controllers_lock_);
00355 
00356   controller_interface::ControllerBase* ct;
00357   // list all controllers to stop
00358   for (unsigned int i=0; i<stop_controllers.size(); i++)
00359   {
00360     ct = getControllerByNameImpl(stop_controllers[i]);
00361     if (ct == NULL){
00362       if (strictness ==  controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Request::STRICT){
00363         ROS_ERROR("Could not stop controller with name %s because no controller with this name exists",
00364                   stop_controllers[i].c_str());
00365         stop_request_.clear();
00366         return false;
00367       }
00368       else{
00369         ROS_DEBUG("Could not stop controller with name %s because no controller with this name exists",
00370                   stop_controllers[i].c_str());
00371       }
00372     }
00373     else{
00374       ROS_DEBUG("Found controller %s that needs to be stopped in list of controllers",
00375                 stop_controllers[i].c_str());
00376       stop_request_.push_back(ct);
00377     }
00378   }
00379   ROS_DEBUG("Stop request vector has size %i", (int)stop_request_.size());
00380 
00381   // list all controllers to start
00382   for (unsigned int i=0; i<start_controllers.size(); i++)
00383   {
00384     ct = getControllerByNameImpl(start_controllers[i]);
00385     if (ct == NULL){
00386       if (strictness ==  controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Request::STRICT){
00387         ROS_ERROR("Could not start controller with name %s because no controller with this name exists",
00388                   start_controllers[i].c_str());
00389         stop_request_.clear();
00390         start_request_.clear();
00391         return false;
00392       }
00393       else{
00394         ROS_DEBUG("Could not start controller with name %s because no controller with this name exists",
00395                   start_controllers[i].c_str());
00396       }
00397     }
00398     else{
00399       ROS_DEBUG("Found controller %s that needs to be started in list of controllers",
00400                 start_controllers[i].c_str());
00401       start_request_.push_back(ct);
00402     }
00403   }
00404   ROS_DEBUG("Start request vector has size %i", (int)start_request_.size());
00405 
00406   // Do the resource management checking
00407   std::list<hardware_interface::ControllerInfo> info_list;
00408   std::vector<ControllerSpec> &controllers = controllers_lists_[current_controllers_list_];
00409   for (size_t i = 0; i < controllers.size(); ++i)
00410   {
00411     bool in_stop_list  = false;
00412 
00413     for(size_t j = 0; j < stop_request_.size(); j++)
00414       in_stop_list = in_stop_list || (stop_request_[j] == controllers[i].c.get());
00415 
00416     bool in_start_list = false;
00417     for(size_t j = 0; j < start_request_.size(); j++)
00418       in_start_list = in_start_list || (start_request_[j] == controllers[i].c.get());
00419 
00420     bool add_to_list = controllers[i].c->isRunning();
00421     if (in_stop_list)
00422       add_to_list = false;
00423     if (in_start_list)
00424       add_to_list = true;
00425 
00426     if (add_to_list)
00427       info_list.push_back(controllers[i].info);
00428   }
00429 
00430   bool in_conflict = robot_hw_->checkForConflict(info_list);
00431   if (in_conflict)
00432   {
00433     ROS_ERROR("Could not switch controllers, due to resource conflict");
00434     stop_request_.clear();
00435     start_request_.clear();
00436     return false;
00437   }
00438 
00439   // start the atomic controller switching
00440   switch_strictness_ = strictness;
00441   please_switch_ = true;
00442 
00443   // wait until switch is finished
00444   ROS_DEBUG("Request atomic controller switch from realtime loop");
00445   while (ros::ok() && please_switch_){
00446     if (!ros::ok())
00447       return false;
00448     usleep(100);
00449   }
00450   start_request_.clear();
00451   stop_request_.clear();
00452 
00453   ROS_DEBUG("Successfully switched controllers");
00454   return true;
00455 }

00459 
00460 
00461 bool ControllerManager::reloadControllerLibrariesSrv(
00462   controller_manager_msgs::ReloadControllerLibraries::Request &req,
00463   controller_manager_msgs::ReloadControllerLibraries::Response &resp)
00464 {
00465   // lock services
00466   ROS_DEBUG("reload libraries service called");
00467   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(services_lock_);
00468   ROS_DEBUG("reload libraries service locked");
00469 
00470   // only reload libraries if no controllers are running
00471   std::vector<std::string> controllers;
00472   getControllerNames(controllers);
00473   if (!controllers.empty() && !req.force_kill){
00474     ROS_ERROR("Controller manager: Cannot reload controller libraries because there are still %i controllers running", (int)controllers.size());
00475     resp.ok = false;
00476     return true;
00477   }
00478 
00479   // kill running controllers if requested
00480   if (!controllers.empty()){
00481     ROS_INFO("Controller manager: Killing all running controllers");
00482     std::vector<std::string> empty;
00483     if (!switchController(empty,controllers, controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Request::BEST_EFFORT)){
00484       ROS_ERROR("Controller manager: Cannot reload controller libraries because failed to stop running controllers");
00485       resp.ok = false;
00486       return true;
00487     }
00488     for (unsigned int i=0; i<controllers.size(); i++){
00489       if (!unloadController(controllers[i])){
00490         ROS_ERROR("Controller manager: Cannot reload controller libraries because failed to unload controller %s",
00491                   controllers[i].c_str());
00492         resp.ok = false;
00493         return true;
00494       }
00495     }
00496     getControllerNames(controllers);
00497   }
00498   assert(controllers.empty());
00499 
00500   // Force a reload on all the PluginLoaders (internally, this recreates the plugin loaders)
00501   for(std::list<LoaderPtr>::iterator it = controller_loaders_.begin(); it != controller_loaders_.end(); ++it)
00502   {
00503     (*it)->reload();
00504     ROS_INFO("Controller manager: reloaded controller libraries for %s", (*it)->getName().c_str());
00505   }
00506 
00507   resp.ok = true;
00508 
00509   ROS_DEBUG("reload libraries service finished");
00510   return true;
00511 }
00512 
00513 
00514 bool ControllerManager::listControllerTypesSrv(
00515   controller_manager_msgs::ListControllerTypes::Request &req,
00516   controller_manager_msgs::ListControllerTypes::Response &resp)
00517 {
00518   // pretend to use the request
00519   (void) req;
00520 
00521   // lock services
00522   ROS_DEBUG("list types service called");
00523   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(services_lock_);
00524   ROS_DEBUG("list types service locked");
00525 
00526   for(std::list<LoaderPtr>::iterator it = controller_loaders_.begin(); it != controller_loaders_.end(); ++it)
00527   {
00528     std::vector<std::string> cur_types = (*it)->getDeclaredClasses();
00529     for(size_t i=0; i < cur_types.size(); i++)
00530     {
00531       resp.types.push_back(cur_types[i]);
00532       resp.base_classes.push_back((*it)->getName());
00533     }
00534   }
00535 
00536   ROS_DEBUG("list types service finished");
00537   return true;
00538 }
00539 
00540 
00541 bool ControllerManager::listControllersSrv(
00542   controller_manager_msgs::ListControllers::Request &req,
00543   controller_manager_msgs::ListControllers::Response &resp)
00544 {
00545   // pretend to use the request
00546   (void) req;
00547 
00548   // lock services
00549   ROS_DEBUG("list controller service called");
00550   boost::mutex::scoped_lock services_guard(services_lock_);
00551   ROS_DEBUG("list controller service locked");
00552 
00553   // lock controllers to get all names/types/states
00554   boost::mutex::scoped_lock controller_guard(controllers_lock_);
00555   std::vector<ControllerSpec> &controllers = controllers_lists_[current_controllers_list_];
00556   resp.controller.resize(controllers.size());
00557 
00558   for (size_t i = 0; i < controllers.size(); ++i)
00559   {
00560     controller_manager_msgs::ControllerState& cs = resp.controller[i];
00561     cs.name               = controllers[i].info.name;
00562     cs.type               = controllers[i].info.type;
00563     cs.hardware_interface = controllers[i].info.hardware_interface;
00564     cs.resources.clear();
00565     cs.resources.reserve(controllers[i].info.resources.size());
00566     for (std::set<std::string>::iterator it = controllers[i].info.resources.begin(); it != controllers[i].info.resources.end(); it++)
00567       cs.resources.push_back(*it);
00568 
00569     if (controllers[i].c->isRunning())
00570       cs.state = "running";
00571     else
00572       cs.state = "stopped";
00573   }
00574 
00575   ROS_DEBUG("list controller service finished");
00576   return true;
00577 }
00578 
00579 
00580 bool ControllerManager::loadControllerSrv(
00581   controller_manager_msgs::LoadController::Request &req,
00582   controller_manager_msgs::LoadController::Response &resp)
00583 {
00584   // lock services
00585   ROS_DEBUG("loading service called for controller %s ",req.name.c_str());
00586   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(services_lock_);
00587   ROS_DEBUG("loading service locked");
00588 
00589   resp.ok = loadController(req.name);
00590 
00591   ROS_DEBUG("loading service finished for controller %s ",req.name.c_str());
00592   return true;
00593 }
00594 
00595 
00596 bool ControllerManager::unloadControllerSrv(
00597   controller_manager_msgs::UnloadController::Request &req,
00598   controller_manager_msgs::UnloadController::Response &resp)
00599 {
00600   // lock services
00601   ROS_DEBUG("unloading service called for controller %s ",req.name.c_str());
00602   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(services_lock_);
00603   ROS_DEBUG("unloading service locked");
00604 
00605   resp.ok = unloadController(req.name);
00606 
00607   ROS_DEBUG("unloading service finished for controller %s ",req.name.c_str());
00608   return true;
00609 }
00610 
00611 
00612 bool ControllerManager::switchControllerSrv(
00613   controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Request &req,
00614   controller_manager_msgs::SwitchController::Response &resp)
00615 {
00616   // lock services
00617   ROS_DEBUG("switching service called");
00618   boost::mutex::scoped_lock guard(services_lock_);
00619   ROS_DEBUG("switching service locked");
00620 
00621   resp.ok = switchController(req.start_controllers, req.stop_controllers, req.strictness);
00622 
00623   ROS_DEBUG("switching service finished");
00624   return true;
00625 }
00626 
00627 void ControllerManager::registerControllerLoader(boost::shared_ptr<ControllerLoaderInterface> controller_loader)
00628 {
00629   controller_loaders_.push_back(controller_loader);
00630 }
